page.title: 09 Mells Park
page.content: When we got to{Mells park}we went up to the house and met the secretary who took us to see the estate manager. He took us round to the front of the house and told us that across the ha-ha is {temple gardens }where there used to be a deer enclosure. Ian said "Who was{Little Jack Horner?"}and the estate manager said that there was a knight called Sir Jack Horner who owned the estate once long ago and perhaps the rhyme refers to him. The estate has got 1200 acres.Most of this land is rented by farmers.The present house was built on the site of an earlier house which was destroyed by a terrible fire but there has been some sort of dwelling here since Norman times.The estate is now owned by an international mining company who are restoring the house and using it as a conference centre.
